info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 23 at 12:00AM CDT until May 23 at 12:30AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM CDT FOR BROWN AND NORTHEASTERN COLEMAN COUNTIES... At 1158 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Lake Brownwood, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe storm will be near... Early around 1210 AM CDT. Brownwood around 1210 AM CDT. Camp Bowie around 1220 AM CDT. Zephyr around 1225 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Indian Creek, Owens and Thrifty. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
